;周日，一支由至少数百名移民组成的大篷车从墨西哥南部城市塔帕丘拉出发，前往美国南部边境。

;

;较小的商队计划;加入另一辆规模较大的汽车;，该汽车于六天前出发，目前停在距维斯特拉镇以北约 25 英里（40 公里）处。

;

;组织者称，第一辆汽车已增至约 7,000 人而南部恰帕斯州政府表示，估计该群体有 3,500 人。

;

;人数众多 ;移民正在逃离家乡的贫困和政治不稳定，他们来自古巴、萨尔瓦多、危地马拉、海地，尤其是洪都拉斯和;委内瑞拉;。

;

;“我认为等待获得人道主义签证 3.4 个月太长了，能够穿越墨西哥领土，”来自委内瑞拉的塞尔玛·阿尔瓦雷斯说。 “因为我们受到土狼和罪犯的摆布，所以我们在大篷车中互相陪伴是件好事，对我来说似乎更安全。”

;

;阿尔瓦雷斯补充说，该组织对;到达美国边境;并开始预约进入美国的流程通过美国政府应用程序 CBP One 获得安全并请求庇护。

;

;寻求明年连任的美国总统乔·拜登面临着减少从墨西哥非法越境进入美国的人数的压力。

;

;;人数创历史新高; 今年已跨越;达连峡地区; 连接巴拿马和哥伦比亚。

;;在对难民营的袭击造成数十人死亡后，巴勒斯坦权力机构主席马哈茂德·阿巴斯在拉马拉与美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯会面时要求以色列立即停火。布林肯拒绝了以色列停火的想法，因为担心这会给哈马斯带来好处，他正在进行一次未经宣布的访问。露西·菲尔德（Lucy Fielder）还有更多。;
;

;以色列周日拒绝了国际社会日益增长的停火压力，并表示，在美国高级外交官忙于遏制可能导致局势进一步升级的危机之际，以色列军队已经包围了加沙城。据巴勒斯坦通讯社 WAFA 报道，加沙周日遭受以色列“前所未有的轰炸”，而巴勒斯坦电信公司 Paltel 表示，所有通信和互联网服务再次被切断。

;

; >;

;巴勒斯坦权力机构主席马哈茂德·阿巴斯在与美国国务卿的会晤中加入国际社会呼吁立即停火;安东尼·布林肯;，他正在对被占领的约旦河西岸进行未经宣布的访问。

;

;但在布林肯重申美国担心停火可能会帮助哈马斯之后以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡排除了这一可能性，除非哈马斯扣押的人质被释放：“如果人质不归还，就不会停火。这应该从词典中彻底删除。”

;

;军方发言人表示，以色列军队已经包围了加沙主要城市：“他们到达了加沙城南部海岸，包围了加沙城。”

;

;黎巴嫩当局表示，以色列对黎巴嫩南部的一辆汽车发动袭击，造成三名儿童和他们的祖母死亡，与黎巴嫩的紧张局势加剧。

;

;以色列首席军事发言人表示，军方已袭击了“黎巴嫩南部真主党的恐怖目标”，以回应针对坦克的导弹袭击，导致一名以色列公民死亡。他说真主党的一架无人机也被击落。

;

;真主党表示，它向黎巴嫩真主党发射火箭弹作为回应。以色列北部的基亚特什莫纳镇。该组织表示绝不会容忍对平民的袭击，其反应将是“坚定而有力”。

;

;以色列中部地区拉响警报，以色列媒体报道火箭弹袭击了以色列北部地区以及特拉维夫周边地区。没有人员伤亡报告。

;

;加沙卫生官员表示，已有超过 9,770 名巴勒斯坦人在战争中丧生，这场战争始于 10 月 7 日哈马斯对以色列南部发动突然袭击，造成 1,400 人死亡并劫持了 240 多名人质。

;

;以色列称，迄今为止已有 31 名士兵被杀。

;

;在 ;加沙马加齐难民营;，哈马斯控制的飞地卫生部称以色列人在那里部队在夜间罢工中造成至少 47 人死亡，人们在寻找受害者或幸存者。

;

;“整个晚上我和其他人都在试图从废墟中捡起死者。 53 岁的赛义德·阿尔内吉马 (Saeed al-Nejma) 说：“我们有孩子、被肢解、肉身撕裂。”他补充说，爆炸袭击他家附近时，他正在和家人一起睡觉。

;

;在被要求置评时，以色列国防军表示以色列国防军表示，他们正在收集详细信息。

;

;卫生部表示，在另一次袭击中，一个家庭的 21 名巴勒斯坦人（包括妇女和儿童）在一夜之间的袭击中丧生。以色列国防军拒绝发表评论。

;

;路透社无法独立核实这些账户。

;

;“我们要求你们立即阻止他们犯下这些罪行，”阿巴斯告诉布林肯，并敦促以色列“立即停火”。< /p>;

;WAFA通讯社援引阿巴斯的话说，巴勒斯坦人正面临一场“种族灭绝和破坏”的战争。

;

;来自卡塔尔、沙特、埃及、约旦和阿拉伯联合酋长国的外交部长会见了布林肯布林肯周六在安曼，还敦促他说服以色列同意停火。布林肯周日还访问了伊拉克，并与总理穆罕默德·苏达尼举行了会谈。

;

;;教皇方济各;加入了和平呼吁。他说：“以上帝的名义停下来”，并呼吁提供人道主义援助并帮助伤者，以缓解加沙“非常严重”的局势。

;

;但布林肯表示，停火将有利于哈马斯，允许它重新集结并再次进攻。相反，美国希望局部暂停战斗，以便提供人道主义援助并让人们离开加沙。

;

;“国务卿重申美国致力于提供救生人道主义援助并恢复基本服务发言人马修·米勒说。

;

;布林肯表示，巴勒斯坦权力机构应该在加沙地带的未来中发挥核心作用，一位美国官员在约旦河西岸访问后表示。

;< p>;周日正在努力通过 ;埃及、美国和卡塔尔官员称，前往埃及的拉法过境点;自周六救护车遭遇致命袭击后暂停。

;

;前往埃及西奈半岛的拉法过境点半岛是加沙唯一不受以色列控制的出口点。两位埃及消息人士称，援助卡车仍然能够进入加沙。

;

;根据国际斡旋协议，疏散行动于周三开始。超过 ;300 多名美国人离开加沙;，副国家安全顾问乔纳森·费纳 (Jonathan Finer) 表示，但仍有一些人留下。

;

;卡塔尔外交部表示，如果加沙没有“平静时期”，其调解人将无法确保释放 ;以色列人质;被扣押在飞地。

;

;海湾国家与美国协调，主导与哈马斯和以色列官员就释放事宜进行会谈人质。

;

;以色列占领地区的暴力事件日益恶化;约旦河西岸;引发了人们的担忧，除了以色列与黎巴嫩的北部边境之外，它可能成为更广泛战争中的第三条战线。

;

;以色列军方发言人丹尼尔·哈加里少将表示，以色列国防军重点是加沙北部的地面行动，“解救我们的人质，并将加沙从哈马斯手中解救出来”。

;

;“我们将调整我们的计划以实现目标，这将需要很长时间，他补充道。

;

;他说，以色列国防军暴露了加沙北部医院下方和附近的哈马斯隧道、指挥中心和火箭发射器网络。

;

;“哈马斯系统性地利用医院作为哈加里告诉记者。

;

;哈马斯在一份声明中呼吁联合国秘书长成立一个国际委员会，访问医院，以反驳以色列关于哈马斯利用医院进行军事活动的“虚假说法”。发动袭击

;

;“可怕的噩梦”

;

;联合国人道主义办公室估计，加沙 230 万人口中有近 150 万人在国内流离失所。

;

;目前进入加沙的援助正在世界粮食计划署负责人辛迪·麦凯恩在视察拉法过境点后表示，“远远”不足以满足人们的需求。

;

;“人们生活在可怕的噩梦中，”麦凯恩说。 “食物和水即将耗尽。现在需要稳定的援助来满足迫切的需求。”

;

;在土耳其南部，数百人在亲巴勒斯坦的集会中，警方使用了催泪瓦斯和高压水枪。布林肯将于周一在安卡拉参加有关加沙问题的会谈，集会试图袭击驻有美军的空军基地。

;US Secretary of State Antony Blinken paid an unannounced visit to Iraq on Sunday, as he tours the Middle East attempting to tamp down tensions after war erupted between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas last month.

;

;After an earlier ;visit to the occupied West Bank;, Blinken landed in Baghdad on Sunday evening for his first visit to the country as the US top diplomat and held talks with Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed al-Sudani.

;

;Washington wants to prevent a wider regional conflict and has stepped up ;diplomacy; with regional countries whose populations have been angered by Israel's assault on Gaza.

;

;Blinken landed at Baghdad's international airport, donned a ballistic vest and traveled by Black Hawk helicopter to the Green Zone, a remnant of the US occupation of Iraq after its 2003 invasion. At the US ambassador's residence he was briefed on threats to US facilities, before heading to the prime minister's office.

;

;He will travel to Turkey later on Sunday, where ;protests; were already underway.

;

;Iran-backed group Kataib Hezbollah issued a warning on Saturday night that the expected Blinken visit would be met with "an unprecedented escalation."

;

;US defense officials say rocket and drone attacks on US and coalition troops have stepped up in Iraq and Syria since Hamas' deadly attacks on Oct. 7 sparked an intensive Israeli military campaign in Gaza.

;

;Iraqi armed groups aligned with Iran have threatened to target US interests with missiles and drones if Washington intervened to support Israel against Hamas in Gaza.

;

;Al Sudani has pledged to pursue the perpetrators of rocket attacks on three military bases in Iraq hosting international coalition advisers, including Ain al-Asad in western Iraq, a military base near Baghdad's international airport and Harir in the northern Iraqi city of Erbil.

;

;Lebanon-based Hezbollah, which like Hamas is backed by US adversary Iran, has launched strikes on northern Israel.

;

;Hezbollah's leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah ;issued a warning; on Friday, as Blinken arrived in the region, that preventing a regional conflict depended on stopping the Israeli attack on Gaza, and said there was a possibility of fighting on the Lebanese front turning into a full-fledged war.

;;The Palestinian Red Crescent Society in Gaza released videos on Sunday (November 5) showing footage of heavy bombardment targeting areas surrounding al-Quds Hospital in Gaza City, and paramedics rushing to evacuate the injured.;
;

;Efforts were under way on Sunday to resume evacuations of foreign nationals and injured Gazans through the ;Rafah crossing; to Egypt, suspended since Saturday after a deadly attack on an ambulance, Egyptian, US and Qatari officials said.

;

;Palestinian telecommunications company Paltel said that all communications and internet services had once again been cut in the Gaza Strip amid continued bombardment while Gaza's health ministry said dozens died in a strike on a refugee camp overnight.

;

;Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas demanded an immediate Israeli ceasefire at a meeting with US Secretary of State ;Antony Blinken; in Ramallah.

;

;Blinken, who has dismissed the idea of a ceasefire by Israel for fear it would benefit Hamas, was making an unannounced visit to the occupied West Bank as part of efforts to prevent the Israel-Hamas war spreading.

;

;Blinken said the Palestinian Authority should play a central role in the future of the Gaza strip, a US official said after the visit.

;

;The Rafah crossing to Egypt's Sinai peninsula is the only exit point from Gaza not controlled by Israel. Aid trucks were still able to travel into Gaza, two Egyptian sources said.

;

;Evacuations began on Wednesday under an internationally brokered deal. More than ;300 Americans have left Gaza;, but some still remain, Jonathan Finer, deputy national security adviser, said.

;

;At the ;Maghazi refugee camp; in Gaza, people searched for victims or survivors.

;

;"All night I and the other men were trying to pick the dead from the rubble. We got children, dismembered, torn-apart flesh," said Saeed al-Nejma, 53, adding that he had been asleep with his family when the blast hit his neighbourhood.

;

;A spokesman for the health ministry in the Hamas-run Gaza Strip said Israeli forces had struck the camp overnight, killing at least 47 people. Asked for comment, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said they were gathering details.

;

;In a separate attack, 21 Palestinians from one family, including women and children, were killed in strikes overnight, the health ministry said. The IDF declined to comment.

;

;Reuters could not independently verify these accounts.

;

;"We demand that you stop them from committing these crimes immediately," Abbas told Blinken, urging an "immediate ceasefire" from Israel.

;

;"There are no words to describe the war of genocide and destruction to which our Palestinian people are being subjected in Gaza at the hands of the Israeli war machine, without regard to the rules of international law," Palestinian news agency WAFA quoted Abbas as telling Blinken.

;

;Foreign ministers from Qatar, Saudi, Egypt, Jordan and the United Arab Emirates met Blinken in Amman on Saturday and also urged him to persuade Israel to agree to a ceasefire.

;

;;Pope Francis; joined calls for peace. “以上帝的名义停止，”他说，呼吁提供人道主义援助和帮助伤者，以缓解加沙“非常严重”的局势。

;

;但布林肯表示，停火将使哈马斯受益，让它重新集结并再次攻击。 Instead, the US wants localised pauses in fighting to allow in humanitarian aid and for people to leave Gaza.

;

;"The Secretary reaffirmed the United States' commitment to the delivery of life-saving humanitarian assistance and resumption of essential services in Gaza," spokesperson Matthew Miller said.

;

;In southern Turkey, police used tear gas and water cannon as hundreds of people at a pro-Palestinian rally tried to storm an air base that houses US troops, hours before Blinken was due in Ankara on Monday for talks on Gaza.

;

;Israel says it is targeting Hamas, not civilians, and that Hamas is using residents as human shields.

;

;Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu again rejected calls for a ceasefire.

;

;"There will be no ceasefire without the return of our hostages, we say this to both our enemies and our friends. We will continue until we beat them," he said.

;

;Israeli military spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari said the IDF were focussing on ground operations in the north of Gaza "to free our hostages and to free Gaza from Hamas".

;

;"We will adapt our plan to stay with the goals, and it will take us a long time," he added.

;

;He said the IDF has exposed a network of Hamas tunnels, command centres and rocket launchers beneath and adjacent to hospitals in northern Gaza.

;

;"Hamas systematically exploits hospitals as part of its war machine," Hagari told reporters.

;

;In a statement, Hamas called on the United Nations secretary general to form an international committee to visit hospitals to debunk Israel's "false claims" that Hamas uses them to launch attacks

;

;Gaza health officials said more than 9,770 Palestinians have been killed in the war, which began when Hamas launched a surprise attack on southern Israel on Oct. 7, killing 1,400 people and taking more than 240 hostage.

;

;Israel said 31 of its soldiers have been killed in Gaza operations so far.

;

;Israel continued to strike the Gaza Strip by air, sea, and ground overnight.

;

;The Palestinian Red Crescent said there was also intense bombardment, artillery explosions and air strikes in the vicinity of the Al-Quds Hospital in Gaza's Tal Al-Hawa area.

;

;The UN humanitarian office estimates that nearly 1.5 million of Gaza's 2.3 million people are internally displaced.

;

;The aid currently entering Gaza is "nowhere near" enough to meet people's needs, World Food Programme head Cindy McCain said after visiting the Rafah border crossing.

;

;"People are living in a horrific nightmare," McCain said. "Food and water are running out. A steady flow of aid is needed to meet the desperate needs now."

;

;Qatar's foreign ministry said that without a "period of calm" in Gaza its mediators would not be able to secure the release of ;Israeli hostages; held in the enclave.

;

;The Gulf state has, in coordination with the US, led mediation talks with Hamas and Israeli officials over the release of hostages since the Oct. 7 attack.

;

;Worsening violence in the Israeli-occupied ;West Bank; has fuelled concerns it could become a third front in a wider war, in addition to Israel's northern border, where clashes with Lebanese Hezbollah forces have mounted.

;

;An Israeli strike on a car in southern Lebanon killed three people on Sunday, security sources in Lebanon said.

;民主党总统;乔·拜登;落后于共和党领跑者;正如美国人所言，唐纳德·特朗普在美国大选前一年在六个最重要的战场州中的五个州中获胜周日公布的民意调查显示，人们对拜登的年龄存有疑虑，并对他对经济的处理感到不满。

;

;这项民意调查是由《纽约时报》和锡耶纳学院进行的。民意调查显示，特朗普在寻求重新夺回总统宝座的同时，在本党 2024 年提名中领先，在亚利桑那州、佐治亚州、密歇根州、内华达州和宾夕法尼亚州领先，拜登在威斯康星州领先。拜登在 2020 年大选中在全部六个州击败了特朗普。民意调查显示，特朗普目前在六个州平均领先 48% 至 44%。

;

;虽然评估全国普选的民意调查一致显示拜登和特朗普在;一场势均力敌的竞选;，总统选举通常由少数人的结果决定所谓的摇摆州。

;

;拜登在亚利桑那州、佐治亚州、密歇根州、宾夕法尼亚州和威斯康星州的胜利——特朗普在 2016 年赢得的所有摇摆州——对他 2020 年的胜利发挥了重要作用。拜登可能需要再次赢得其中许多州才能赢得连任。

;

;“一年多后的预测往往在一年后看起来会有所不同。不要相信我们的话：盖洛普预测奥巴马总统将落后 8 个百分点，结果一年后他就轻松获胜，”拜登竞选发言人凯文·穆尼奥斯在一份声明中表示，指的是民主党人巴拉克·奥巴马 2012 年战胜共和党人米特·罗姆尼。

;

;穆尼奥斯拜登补充道，拜登的竞选活动“正在努力争取和动员我们多元化的、获胜的选民联盟，一年后，我们要在我们获胜的、受欢迎的议程和MAGA（特朗普的“让美国再次伟大”口号）共和党人不受欢迎的极端主义之间做出选择。我们”我们将通过埋头苦干，而不是担心民意调查来赢得 2024 年的胜利。”

;

;民意调查显示，拜登的多种族、多代际联盟似乎正在破裂。

;

;民调显示，30岁以下选民对80岁拜登的支持率仅一个百分点，他在拉美裔选民中的领先优势已降至个位数，而他在城市地区的优势是特朗普在农村地区优势的一半。

;

;黑人选民（拜登的核心人口）目前在这些州对特朗普的支持率为 22%，据《纽约时报》报道，这一水平在现代共和党总统政治中是前所未见的。

;

;康涅狄格州民主党参议员理查德·布卢门撒尔 (Richard Blumenthal) 告诉 CNN：“在这些民意调查之前我很担心，现在也很担心。”

;

;“这里不会有人会出现一场失控的选举。 ...我们有我们的工作要做，”布卢门撒尔补充道。

;

;今年，近 32,000 名移民乘坐脆弱的船只从西非抵达西班牙加那利群岛，超过了 2006 年创下的纪录，地方当局周日表示。

;

;地方当局告诉路透社，今年到目前为止，已有 31,933 人抵达这些岛屿，而 2006 年小船危机时，有 31,678 人抵达加那利群岛。

;

;西班牙海岸警卫队表示，自周五以来，已有 739 人在大西洋群岛中最小、最西端的岛屿耶罗岛 (El Hierro) 附近获救。

;

;四艘船上有两人死亡，西班牙国民警卫队周六表示，另外两人后来在医院死亡，该部队也参与了救援，获救的人中有妇女和儿童。

;

;加那利群岛地区负责人费尔南多·克拉维霍 (Fernando Clavijo) 表示这些数字显示了该群岛面临的人道主义危机的规模，并呼吁西班牙政府和欧盟提供更多帮助。

;

;“2006年的数据已被超越，但国家和欧盟的反应是不一样。南部边境的移民管理必须成为西班牙和欧洲议程上的优先事项，”他周六在 X 社交媒体网站上发帖称。

;

;随着天气转暖和海面平静，抵达人数最近猛增。九月使得尝试从非洲穿越仍然危险的通道变得更加可行。

;

;该群岛距离非洲西海岸约 100 公里（60 英里）。其七个岛屿已成为来自塞内加尔和墨西哥的移民的主要目的地。其他非洲国家试图前往西班牙，逃离冲突或寻求更好的生活。

;

;西班牙政府表示，将在军营、酒店和招待所为约 3,000 名移民提供额外的紧急住所。
